basics.label: Product Management & UX Leader
basics.name: Tim Feeley
basics.summary: Hello! I’m a PM & UX leader with two decades of experience developing high-performing teams and delivering impactful products used by billions of people. _Not a drag to work with, either._

projects.name: Facebook News Feed Redesign
projects.summary: Starting late 2016, my team and the News Feed team set out to explore how we could make News Feed more readable, conversational, and easier to navigate. See the hard work of our designers, researchers and engineers here!

references.name: Loi Sessions Goulet
references.reference: Despite being intimidatingly good at his job, Tim was a warm and welcoming presence when I first joined TripAdvisor. As a team-of-one researcher, Tim was an incredible partner to me - playing an instrumental role in building in a traveler-focused product culture. I have fond memories of the UX 101 training we developed and hope to reprise it someday!

references.name: Aaron Clark
references.reference: Tim is the best. We were hired on the same day in 2006 when he was still a toddler and I had the absolute pleasure of watching him grow into a wonderful PM over the next 4 years, ultimately earning the title of Director. He's an incredibly fun, funny, compassionate, kind, lovable soul, to say nothing of his product and tech skills. I'd be thrilled to have Tim on my team again anytime and anywhere.

references.name: Ali Aslam
references.reference: Truly a MacGyver of product development, Tim is a force of creativity, full-stack technical knowledge, and killer product instincts, all wrapped up in one. I had the pleasure of working with Tim for over 5 years. During that time I saw him deftly glide from full-stack development to project management to product management. Tim has a very mellow yet meticulous and engaging work style. This always resulted in very creative and productive brainstorming sessions. I've always been impressed with his problem solving skills, whether working with the CEO or an engineer. Tim has a great ability to put himself in the customer's shoes and design engaging, easy to use products. Always ON and always tinkering, it's impossible to have a boring day when Tim is around. With an excellent work ethic, great attention to detail, and a killer wit, Tim would be a huge asset to any creative or product development endeavor.

references.name: Mandy R. Drew
references.reference: Tim is, by far, the best UX Director I've ever had the pleasure to work with. His creativity and knowledge of all aspects of user experience knows no bounds, his instructions are always clear and concise, and he provides excellent guidance whenever I need a fresh pair of eyes or a new perspective on any project. Tim is not only a great leader, but a true collaborator as well. I would love the chance to work with Tim again in the future, and highly recommend him for any position for which he is considered.

references.name: Carol McManus
references.reference:
I worked as a contractor for Tim's company helping them grow their marketing team as well as doing off-site customer focus groups.  I honestly cannot say enough about Tim.
First, his technical know-how allowed for planning product roadmaps in a way that's strongly rooted in technical reality while still staying true. to delighting customers by meeting their requirements which we learned together during our interviews/focus groups.
Second, he is a data-drive decision maker!  Tim combines primary research/secondary research and competitive benchmarking/best practices to delivery value specific to his target market segments.
I always found Tim to be engaging, creative, excellent on follow-though and a joy to work with.  I highly recommend him to anyone looking for great talent.

references.name: Brian Walker
references.reference: Tim is one of the most detailed oriented Product Directors I have worked with. His technical background is a huge asset in Tim's ability to define business requirements in terms that can be quickly understood by his technology partners. His hands on skills to dive into technical tool analysis and if needed, implementation is a huge strength. Particularly in smaller organizations that need team members with wide ranging capabilities.  Tim also handles a very large workload and does an excellent job at prioritizing to meet business needs.

references.name: Kevin Hoeschele
references.reference: As a product manager with a tech background  He understands designing  products from the management & from the implementation.  Tim was one of my favorite people to work with at OLB due to his strong designs and attention to detail.

references.name: Ken Herron
references.reference:
Have you ever had someone who worked for you that was so smart, you felt like you could hear the gears turning in his/her head every time you gave them a problem to solve?

Tim was my "product guy" (officially software developer and product manager), whose day job was to define and prioritize the constant flow of new requirements for our software.  His night job?  Tim was the "trilingual" diplomat brokering peace agreements between our senior management, developers, and other project stakeholders to keep our business running.

Tim was not just a champion of user-centered design [who proactively shared his knowledge to educate the rest of the organization], but a blisteringly smart leader who was able to combine his deep domain expertise with his business acumen to make our company the market leader!

references.name: Jessica Hamel
references.reference: It was a privilege to work with Tim.  Although we worked in different groups, the Marketing and Professional Services teams fully supported one another, and Tim always went above the call of duty when I needed him.  Tim's technical expertise paired with his customer-oriented attitude and drive for greatness will surely make him an asset to any company.

references.name: David S. Novak, MSW, LICSW
references.reference:
I have worked closely with Tim on multiple projects while working together at Online Buddies, Inc. From the design, implementation, and custom enhancements of our health site, to providing expert consultative services and internal analytics to global research projects, Mr. Feeley has meaningfully contributed to what is now the OLB Research Institute.

I’ve also observed Tim successfully manage our entire product department department and staff, resulting in the launch of several new initiatives. His ability to manage several complicated project release timelines across several departments makes him the consummate multi-tasker and leader. Online Buddies wouldn’t be the same without him.

highlights: Evangelized 0 > 1 team and product charter to ship usable MVPs to secure staffing and cross-team commitments for scaled investment.
Extensive research allowed us to release policy templates that over _80% of teams_ could use out of the box, with zero additional configuration.
work.name: Google
work.summary: Created centralized infrastructure for thousands of Google systems that measurably increased their security posture by streamlining policy configuration, auditing, and enforcement.

highlights: Consolidated identity capabilities across 6 lines of business, aligning functional teams and tech stacks, _decreasing operational costs by 30%._
Led dozens of local experiments to increase conversion by ••% and identify patterns for a next-gen multi channel onboarding UI system.
work.name: Goldman Sachs
work.position: VP, Product Management, Identity & Account Opening
work.summary: Developed a customizable and centralized platform for account opening and identity management, serving 9M+ accounts while increasing signup conversion.

highlights: Optimized account messaging UI and UX to reduce account lockouts by 40% and achieved KYC outcomes for millions of accounts.
Acquired •••M business signups annually by creating SMB-tailored accounts and onboarding, _growing active commercial usage by 30%._

Migrated •••Ms of accounts from three acquisitions to Google’s Identity platform, streamlining platform migration as well as customer UX to convert bespoke customer records to use Google identity stack.
work.name: Google
work.summary: Responsible for the end-to-end experiences 4B+ people use to create, access and manage their Google accounts, including the underlying internal and third-party APIs.

highlights: Led UX refresh of News Feed (2B+ MAUs), resulting in _3% increase in engagement_ and revenue worldwide through an incrementally-shipped and optimized UI overhaul that increased creation and conversations
Evolved the Facebook Design System, enabling 300+ designers to build 15% faster; continuous pattern optimization _increased app usage 1% pt._
work.name: Meta
work.summary: Responsible for the global Facebook UX library, providing the designs, code and guidance to craft beautiful, simple interfaces—with measurable results.

highlights: Led a refresh of high-traffic SEO pages, resulting in _6x engagement increase_ with key brand features through UI and UX optimizations.
Led the redesign of photo and map experiences, resulting in a _100% increase in interaction rates_ and an increase in revenue.
Developed and launched faceted search, resulting in 30% increase in navigation success and a reduction in landing page bounces.
work.name: Tripadvisor
work.position: Director of Product Management, Site Experience
work.summary: Created and led the Site Experience team, improving how travelers navigate and experience the site and apps, managing seven reports, two managers & 30+ engineers across 3 offices.

highlights: Built and led the PM, design, and research capabilities to support international expansion and product line development.
_Decreased paid subscription churn by 15%_ by improving profile discoverability, communication channels, and notification strategies.
work.name: Online Buddies, Inc.
work.position: Director of Product Management & User Experience
work.summary: Established and developed the PM practice, resulting in core product growth, successful integration of acquisitions and public health partnerships for 6M+ members worldwide.
